Metadata.title: Piroola: Professional AI Audio Mixing & Mastering Online
Metadata.description: Transform your tracks with Piroola. Our AI-powered mixing and mastering service delivers professional studio-quality results from your multi-track stems in minutes.

HeroSection.description: Transform your home recordings (stems) into professional, Spotify-ready mixes in minutes. Piroola handles the technical engineering so you can focus on the music.

FeaturesSection.title: From your DAW to the World.
FeaturesSection.subtitle: We have simplified the complex engineering process. No infinite menus, only superior sonic results.

0.title: Intelligent Analysis
0.description: Our AI scans your tracks to understand key, tempo, genre, and instrumentation, creating a custom mixing strategy.

1.title: Precision Mixing
1.description: Piroola applies surgical EQ, dynamic compression, and spatial enhancements tailored to each stem's role in the mix.

2.title: Creative Control
2.description: Adjust the workflow to your needs for optimal sound. Configure your instruments and musical styles to their fullest potential.

3.title: Mastering Grade Polish
3.description: Finalizes your track with industry-standard loudness matching, stereo widening, and limiter safety.

BenefitsSection.speedTitle: Hours of work, done in minutes.
BenefitsSection.speedDescription: Forget about tedious gain staging, phase alignment, and resonance cleanup. Piroola handles the technical heavy lifting so you can focus on the creative vibe.
BenefitsSection.qualityDescription: You don't need a million-dollar studio or decades of experience to get a professional sound. Our algorithms are trained on hit records to deliver commercially competitive results.

LiveSoundAnalysis.label: Live Analytics Engine
LiveSoundAnalysis.title: Visualize the Invisible.
LiveSoundAnalysis.description: Stop guessing. Piroola provides surgical precision metrics to ensure your mix meets streaming standards (Spotify, Apple Music) and broadcast.

metrics.description: Excellent mono compatibility. No critical phase cancellations.

PipelineInteractiveDiagram.label: Audio Engineering Workflow
PipelineInteractiveDiagram.title: Mixing & Mastering Pipeline
PipelineInteractiveDiagram.description: Interactively explore each stage of the audio production process, from initial analysis to final polishing.

0.title: Analysis
0.shortDesc: Frequency, phase, and dynamic range diagnosis.
0.desc: Before processing, understanding the source material is crucial. We use spectrum analyzers, phase correlation meters, and LUFS meters to identify resonant issues, tonal imbalances, or phase problems.
0.tip: Always listen in mono initially to detect phase cancellations.

1.title: Correction
1.shortDesc: Cleaning, subtractive EQ, and noise reduction.
1.desc: The surgical stage. We remove problematic frequencies with subtractive EQ, reduce background noise, and correct vocal pitch if necessary. The goal is to clean before enhancing.
1.tip: Cut low frequencies (High Pass) on instruments that don't need them to gain clarity.

2.title: Dynamics
2.desc: We control the dynamic range for a consistent mix. We use compressors to glue elements together and soft limiters to tame unruly peaks.
2.tip: Use serial compression (multiple gentle compressors) instead of a single aggressive one for a more natural sound.

3.title: Spatial
3.desc: We create the song's 3D world. We place instruments in the stereo field (panning) and add depth with reverb and delay.
3.tip: Keep the kick, bass, and lead vocal in the center. Move rhythmic and harmonic elements to the sides.

4.title: Mastering
4.shortDesc: Loudness, final cohesion, and delivery formats.
4.desc: The final polish. We aim for competitive commercial loudness, global tonal balance, and ensure the song translates well to any playback system (car, phone, club).
4.tip: Always compare your master with reference songs of the same genre (A/B testing).

AuthModal.experiencePower: Experience the power of an advanced AI mastering engine.

MixTool.songModeWarning: Song mode requires exactly one WAV file.
MixTool.selectionWarning: You have selected only one stem. If you want to master a song, select Song (Mastering).
MixTool.pipelineStepsDesc: Enable or disable pipeline stages for this job.

S0_SESSION_FORMAT.title: Session format & routing
S0_SESSION_FORMAT.description: Normalizes samplerate/bit depth and assigns logical buses to start clean.

S1_STEM_DC_OFFSET.title: DC offset check
S1_STEM_DC_OFFSET.description: Detects and fixes DC offsets on each stem.

S1_STEM_WORKING_LOUDNESS.title: Working loudness
S1_STEM_WORKING_LOUDNESS.description: Matches working level per stem based on its instrument profile.

S1_KEY_DETECTION.title: Key detection
S1_KEY_DETECTION.description: Estimates the song's global key and scale.

S1_VOX_TUNING.title: Vocal tuning
S1_VOX_TUNING.description: Tunes the lead vocal while respecting the detected key.

S1_MIXBUS_HEADROOM.title: Mixbus headroom
S1_MIXBUS_HEADROOM.description: Adjusts global headroom to leave space for processing.

S2_GROUP_PHASE_DRUMS.title: Phase alignment (drums)
S2_GROUP_PHASE_DRUMS.description: Aligns phase/polarity across drums and percussion.

S3_MIXBUS_HEADROOM.title: Mixbus headroom
S3_MIXBUS_HEADROOM.description: Adjusts global headroom to leave space for processing.

S3_LEADVOX_AUDIBILITY.title: Lead vocal audibility
S3_LEADVOX_AUDIBILITY.description: Balances the lead vocal against the static mix.

S4_STEM_HPF_LPF.title: HPF/LPF per stem
S4_STEM_HPF_LPF.description: Applies high/low-pass filters per stem based on instrument profile.

S4_STEM_RESONANCE_CONTROL.title: Resonance control
S4_STEM_RESONANCE_CONTROL.description: Detects and tames narrow resonances on each stem.

S5_LEADVOX_DYNAMICS.title: Lead vocal dynamics
S5_LEADVOX_DYNAMICS.description: Compression and dynamics control for the lead vocal.

S5_BUS_DYNAMICS_DRUMS.title: Drum bus dynamics
S5_BUS_DYNAMICS_DRUMS.description: Drum-bus compression on drums for punch and glue.

S6_BUS_REVERB_STYLE.title: Bus reverb & space
S6_BUS_REVERB_STYLE.description: Style-aware reverb and space assignment per bus family.

S7_MIXBUS_TONAL_BALANCE.title: Mixbus tonal balance
S7_MIXBUS_TONAL_BALANCE.description: Broad EQ to match the tonal balance to the target style.

S8_MIXBUS_COLOR_GENERIC.title: Mixbus color
S8_MIXBUS_COLOR_GENERIC.description: Gentle saturation/color on the mixbus for cohesion.

S9_MASTER_GENERIC.title: Master prep
S9_MASTER_GENERIC.description: Pre-master adjustment (level and balance) before final QC.

S10_MASTER_FINAL_LIMITS.title: Master final QC
S10_MASTER_FINAL_LIMITS.description: Final check of TP/LUFS/correlation with micro-adjustments.

S11_REPORT_GENERATION.title: Report Generation
S11_REPORT_GENERATION.description: Generation of the final process report.

MixTool.stemsProfileDesc: Label each stem with its function in the mix. Later we will use these profiles to route buses.
MixTool.spaceDepthDesc: Assign a reverb/space style per bus family to guide later stages.

drums.label: Drums bus
drums.description: Drum kit, programmed drums, loops, etc.

fx.label: FX / Ear candy bus
fx.description: Risers, impacts, vocal chops, creative FX.

ambience.label: Ambience / Atmos bus
ambience.description: Ambiences, atmospheres, room mics, background FX.

other.label: Other bus
other.description: Any stem not classified in the previous categories.

result.aiDesc: AI mix & mastering (result). Listen to the final mix after processing.

Studio.title: Piroola Studio
Studio.selectTrack: Select a track to view waveform

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our AI mixing and mastering service.

0.question: What is Piroola?
0.answer: Piroola is an advanced online service that uses Artificial Intelligence to mix and master your multi-track audio files. It analyzes your stems and applies professional studio techniques to deliver radio-ready quality tracks in minutes.

1.question: How does the AI mixing work?
1.answer: Our AI pipeline analyzes each stem for frequency content, dynamics, and tonal balance. It then applies corrective processing (EQ, compression), balances levels, places instruments in the stereo field, and adds effects like reverb to create a cohesive mix, tailored to your genre.

2.question: What file formats are supported?
2.answer: We support most standard audio formats including WAV, AIFF, FLAC, and MP3. For the best results, we recommend uploading high-quality uncompressed WAV or AIFF files (24-bit / 44.1kHz or higher).

3.question: Is my music secure?
3.answer: Yes, your security is our priority. Your files are processed securely on our servers and are automatically deleted after a short period. We do not claim any rights to your music; you retain 100% ownership of your work.

4.question: How long does the process take?
4.answer: Most mixes are completed within a few minutes, depending on the number of stems and the length of the track. You will see a progress bar indicating each step of the analysis and mixing process.

5.question: Can I upload stems?
5.answer: Absolutely. In fact, our service is designed for stems! You can upload individual instrument tracks (like kick, snare, bass, vocals) to allow our AI to mix them together perfectly.

6.question: What is the difference between mixing and mastering?
6.answer: Mixing involves balancing individual tracks (stems) to form a song, including adjusting levels, panning, and adding effects. Mastering is the final step that polishes the mixed song, ensuring it sounds consistent and loud enough for commercial release.

7.question: Do I own the rights to the mixed track?
7.answer: Yes! You maintain full copyright and ownership of your original music and the final mix produced by Piroola. You can release your tracks on any streaming platform without paying us royalties.

8.question: What if I'm not satisfied with the result?
8.answer: We provide a detailed report of the processing applied. If the result isn't what you expected, you can try adjusting the input stems (e.g., cleaning up noise) or ensuring your files are correctly labeled, and run the process again.

9.question: Is there a file size limit?
9.answer: Currently, we support reasonable file sizes typical for music production stems. If you encounter issues with extremely large projects, consider exporting your stems at a standard sample rate (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).

10.question: How do I download my results?
10.answer: Once the processing is complete, a 'Download' button will appear. You can download the final mixed and mastered stereo file directly to your device.

11.question: Can I use Piroola on mobile?
11.answer: Yes, our website is fully responsive and works on mobile devices. However, for managing multiple stem files, a desktop computer might offer a smoother workflow.

Pricing.title: Pricing
Pricing.subtitle: Pricing plans for every stage of your journey
Pricing.description: Choose the perfect plan for your audio production needs. From demos to professional releases, we have you covered.
